actions.text: Amendment SA 2629 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 38 - 56. Record Vote Number: 22.

Amendment SA 2629 proposed by Senator Corzine. (consideration: CR S1663-1666, S1670; text: CR S1663) To protect the rights of law enforcement officers who are victimized by crime to secure compensation from those who participate in the arming of criminals.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 2629 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 38 - 56. Record Vote Number: 22.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 2629 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 38 - 56. Record Vote Number: 22.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2629 proposed by Senator Corzine.

purpose: To protect the rights of law enforcement officers who are victimized by crime to secure compensation from those who participate in the arming of criminals.
